page.title: 02CHURCH HISTORY
page.content: The church could have been built as early as AD650.There are traces of an original Saxon nave window in one of the present arches of the church.One of the stained glass windows recently fitted includes hunting,cricketing and scenes of the village.The Greene family have memorials in the church one of which is suitable for brass-rubbing.Lady Greene was the grandmother of Queen Catherine Parr.The original Arms of Queen Elizabeth dated 1592 and of King George IV are fixed to the interior north wall.The spire rebuilt in 1956 can be seen for many miles with an avenue of trees leading to Easton Neston House,home of the Hesketh family.
